alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 11:21AM EST until January 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. .Moderate rainfall over the upper French Broad River watershed resulted in 1-2 inches of accumulation on Thursday. Excessive runoff caused significant stream rises on tributaries as well as the upper French Broad River, resulting in isolated areas of bankfull rises and nuisance flooding of adjacent, low-lying areas. The upper French Broad River from Brevard to Penrose, Blantyre, and Etowah is nearing crest at 15.6 feet and will begin a slow recession this afternoon into the evening hours. However, additional heavy rainfall is possible on Saturday and given high streamflows and saturated soils, additional rises on the French Broad River and associated tributaries are likely. In anticipation of new rises, a River Flood Warning may be issued later today for Minor flooding along the upper French Broad River later Saturday into Sunday. Residents, business owners, and other interested parties should stay weather aware and monitor the latest forecasts. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:01 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.6 feet and nearing crest. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting around 15.6 feet and will begin a slow recession late Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. New river rises are possible later Saturday morning through Saturday night with additional heavy rainfall expected. A Flood Warning may be necessary for a Minor Flood Stage exceedance late Saturday into Sunday. Stay weather aware and monitor the latest forecasts. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Saturday morning at 1000 AM EST.
